column4: Anyone know how to make a bootable volume from an ISO in Ubuntu?
a Windows 7 VM with Microsoft's official software for creating Windows 7 boot disks, also doesn't work
maybe a pc problem with booting from that usb
Same disk I used to install this installation of Ubuntu, as well as my previous Windows 7 boot disk
Plus I've tried it with another disk
Not sure. I've formatted it many a time in many a way, though.
Including NTFS, FAT (whichever FAT the Disk Utility does by default), and no partition scheme at all
FAT32 should work, but FAT16 is safe
Although, DD formats it to UDF anyway
And a lot of things don't recognize the UDF at all, just see it as empty, e.g. Windows and GParted
Ubuntu seems to recognize the UDF volume, though
Not sure... it's a Dell XPS M1530 with BIOS revision 12
